greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest base b such that there exist exactly n Wieferich primes (primes p satisfying b^(p-1) == 1 (mod p^2)) less than b.
comment: a(n) == A252232(n) iff a(n) is prime.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{b = 2, p}, While[p = Prime@ Range@ PrimePi[b - 1]; Count[ PowerMod[b, p - 1, p^2], 1] != n, b++]; b]; Array[f, 11] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 11 2015 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=1, 10, b=2; while(b > 0, i=0; forprime(p=1, b, if(Mod(b, p^2)^(p-1)==1, i++)); if(i==n, print1(b, ", "); break({1})); b++))
results.author: _Felix Fröhlich_, Mar 10 2015
ext: a(11) from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 11 2015
a(12) from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 12 2015
